caption:
This photograph captures a vivid and active scene of transportation involving multiple modes. In the foreground, a large river is shown with a tugboat actively pushing a barge. The boat, prominently labeled as "LISA KELCE" on its starboard side, is navigated by a crew; a person can be seen standing on the rear deck of the tugboat.

Dominating the middle ground is a multi-column bridge that spans the river. The bridge has a truss design and appears sturdy, supporting road traffic above. Beneath the bridge structure, various traffic elements can be seen, including a freight train passing parallel to the river. The train consists of several cars, indicating a mix of cargo being transported.

In the background, directly across the river, stands a densely wooded area, providing a lush green backdrop to the industrial activities taking place in the river and the transportation infrastructure. Just before the treeline, a minor road runs along the riverside, with several cars visible, suggesting routine vehicular movement in this area.

Overall, the composition blends natural and man-made elements and showcases a dynamic environment where water, rail, and road transportation converge in a picturesque, yet industrially intense landscape.
title: Coal barge on the kanawha river near Charleston, West Virginia.  Great amounts of steam coal are moved on waterways in the united states because the cost is cheaper than using other forms of transportation
